measured_by: Intertemporal choice task (small/soon vs. large/late reward choices)
justification: Methods: “The measurement part [of the task] was intended to measure participants’ individual temporal discounting.”

measured_by: Proportion of repeated choices and response-time switch cost within the intertemporal choice task
justification: Experiment 1 aimed “to establish the choice repetition effects… (i.e., higher proportion of choice repetitions and faster response times for repetitions than for switches).”

measured_by: Selection Bias (SB) score derived from fixation frequencies
justification: Eye-tracking section: “We used fixation frequencies to calculate the Selection Bias (SB)… SB was 1 if all fixations were on small/soon AOIs… and –1 if all fixations were on large/late AOIs.”
Hypothesis 7: “We expect the last fixated option to predict choice,” identifying the last fixation variable as the measure of the gaze-cascade effect.

measured_by: Number of fixations on value AOIs versus time AOIs
justification: Hypothesis 5: “We expect a higher amount of fixations on the monetary dimension than on the temporal dimension,” showing fixation counts on these AOIs operationalise the bias.
construct: Attentional bias toward monetary vs. temporal information
